comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: You really wasted your time on something this meaningless?..... Speechless

comments.author: fillippone
comments.body: Being given a red trust is not a proof of anything per se. Itâ€™s just a single user not trusting another one for various reasons. Something to consider about such users, together with other elements. I have been given a red trust, my name is in the list, this is why I am commenting in this nonsense.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AM I hope this topic will be useful and informative.I would certainly not bid on that.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I do not know why I am named on that list, but I am not active DT member, therefore I rarely give positive or negative trust (at leaste during the past months,).+ I am not a trusted member (DT1 member), and therefore the opinions that I leave are personal and you are free to trust them or not. So what is the point of this topic?and you have a 1 POST, Is this an alternate account or am I missing a story?

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AM<â€¦>Having negative Trust on the counters is really an indicator though, and when reading into the numbers, one should also read through the associated Trust comments, references, and global Trust context for the given profile. For example, Iâ€™ve got some (untrusted feedback) negative Trust from 2019. If I recall correctly, both cases a retaliation feedback instances for giving out negative Trust beforehand to hoaxers. Those that are more prominent in using the Trust system to signal potential or factual scammers are often reciprocally tagged with some pretend pretext, which normally doesnâ€™t really amount to anything. There are also a bunch of ratings that are not commerce/scam related, and that therefore donâ€™t really follow the intended use, being yet another reason for people to read the comments on the ratings.Note: Strange first topic to choose, in Reputation of all places, from a Newbie account. Obviously not really a Newbie in terms of Bitcointalk.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AMHello!Â My past idea did not find support, so I decided to implement it in a different format.Your past idea? What was it? No matter how you present the information here, it will still be useless to the community. What exactly are you trying to achieve with this list?

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: I don't know what your goal is for this thread. but I'm sure you are not a newbie. then why create a reputation thread with a red trust focus?everyone who reads your thread will know that you are no newbie. what happened to your main account?OP, if you're done, you can lock your thread. there isn't much to discuss in your topic.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I'm curious what was going through Op's head while he was making this thread. I don't see how compiling a list of users who have given negative feedback to others will benefit the forum. Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AMHello!Â My past idea did not find support, so I decided to implement it in a different format.If you consider this thread to be an improvement, I'm curious what your previous thread looked like.Op, the data you used to create this thread is out of date, and you didn't bother to check it. I checked a few of those on the list and most of them have risen in rank; for example, in your list you listed me as a "Jr member," but I'm now a "full member," which just goes to show how out of date your entire thread is.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Someone is obviously bored in life, and besides, they have no idea how the trust system works, and even less that red trust feedback from a scammer means nothing. Even administrators and global mods along with most of the staff are on this list, so the OP probably thinks the whole forum is one big scam. However, the list is a bit short, because there are thousands of those who have a red trust, so I hope that the OP will continue to add to the list

comments.author: avp2306
comments.body: Did you just waste your time for this total nonsense? Well nice try but you cannot convince people to follow what you said because its very clear that you are trolling this section and just want to have fun with the users you listed.Anyways I'm impress on how you work with those since imagine you made it in alphabetically in order, it takes a lot of time and effort before you can create that thread.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: The trust system main feature is what you are doing right now thatâ€™s why you donâ€™t get any support on this idea since this is just a redundant and waste of time attempt to gain merit.Trust system is not moderated and anyone can give red trust base on there own personal feelings. I donâ€™t understand the purpose of collecting all the issue here regarding trust since thereâ€™s already a reference for those negative trust and no cares on somebody personal trust issue. Trust score is visible for warning purposes.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AMdo not hesitate to write me a PM!PM for what is it.....!You have gathered 323 members with different ranks here, aim please......!Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AMMy past idea did not find support,Ideas, who owns something like this and who supports you and tells you to make a topic like this, I think this is the strangest idea at the end of 2022.Whether we will see even more outlandish ideas in the future.Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AMThis list mentions the reasons for the Red TrustYou are wrong, people can see for themselves in the profile list of trust about Redtrust and reference.Quote from: CarlBMenger on December 23, 2022, 09:49:04 AMEscrowEscrow what are you talking about....!I thought this topic was about April mods, i was wrong, december 2022 apparently.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Oh no I'm on the list what will I ever do?I guess we all upset some scammer someplace.Would be interesting to generate a list of all the people we have left red trust for and then see where they overlap and then see if we could figure out who keeps getting outed as a scammer and keeps coming back.Or, we could all just laugh at the troll and move on.Either one works for me.-Dave

Anyway, there are so many ways that you can contribute to this forum and this certainly is not the one of them.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: What a lame and desperate attempt to gain a single merit.Â  Â You said there were refferences to the red-tags, and a reason for them, but the funny thing is you provided a link with my name that points to a post in the Known Alts thread, but I didn't even give that individual a red-tag.Â  I left him a neutral-tag.This is absolutely the stupidest thread I've ever been summoned to.Â  And the fact that you had to use a sockpuppet to post this garbage, and admitted as much...Â  SMH

Over 1000 posts with 0 merits. I see members receive good number of merits from meta board. Shall I make a post with an exclusive idea that everyone will like and give me so many merits? No, I think I need to create a new account, start very fresh and make a post sharing my idea. Everyone will like it and my new account will receive many merits. Some day I will become a merit cycling club member like the BOT, Foxpup will hire me in the team and pay me some life changing btc. I will also take a spot in Chipmixer and make a lot of money.Here the "I" is the OP ðŸ˜‚
